newsitem.title: USA: CME live, feeder cattle called .10 -.20 ct lower.
newsitem.headline: CME live, feeder cattle called .10 -.20 ct lower.

text.p: CME live and feeder cattle futures were called mostly 0.10 to 0.20 cent per lb lower, with a few calls for steady, analysts said.

A week-long decline in cash beef prices plus slow feedlot cattle markets this week should attract more selling to the futures, analysts said. A few cattle traded Thursday at $65.00 per cwt in Plains feedlot markets, but unless more trade Friday analysts expect $64.00 bids next week.
Late Thursday, USDA quoted beef cutout values down $0.32 to $0.15 per cwt.
Also, some analysts said meat packers have a large number of contract cattle becoming available in June, which may lessen demand for them to make new purchases next week.

Feeder cattle were called 0.10-0.20 cent per lb lower with pressure expected from lower cash feeder cattle prices, forecasts for higher corn prices and ideas the long-term uptrend in feeder cattle futures may be over.

The latest CME feeder cattle index was down $0.10 at $77.35 per cwt. CBOT corn futures were called two to three cents per bushel higher in reaction to bullish USDA export figures released early Friday.
